name: reglaze
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to put a new or different piece of glass into a window, or to replace all the glass in a glass structure or roof: They have raised enough money to reglaze the original Victorian glass roof. We had the window re-glazed with glass twice as thick as the original glass.
More examplesFewer examplesIf your timber windows are only 10 years old, they shouldn't need replacing, just reglazing.They have unveiled plans to reglaze the glasshouses in the walled gardens.More than 2,000 glass panes have been re-glazed.The roof will be restored, re-glazed and repainted.
